data.title: Most sources cite one Otto I Gf von Scheyern (d
data.text:
This will be a four-section account of the houses of Habsburg and Lorraine.

Section I, Lorraine.

Part 1.

Ct Gerhard of Alsace (d.Remiremont 1070; see Section 1, Part 1a) m.Hedwig of Namur, a granddaughter of Duke Charles of Lorraine (son of King Louis IV of France), and in 1048 he was given Upper Lorraine; they had issue:

1.Duke Dietrich II of Lorraine, d.30 Dec 1115; m.1st Hedwig, dau.of Ct Friedrich von Formbach; m.2d 1095/6 Gertrude, dau.of Ct Robert I of Flanders

[by 1st m.]:

1.1.Duke Simon I of Lorraine, d.13/14 Jan 1139; m.Adelaide, dau.of Ct Baldwin of Hainault

1.1.1.Duke Matthias I of Lorraine, d.13 May 1176; m.ca 1138 Bertha, dau.of Duke Friedrich II of Swabia

1.1.1.1.Duke Simon II of Lorraine, d.1 Apr 1206; m.1st Agnes von Veldenz; m.2d after 1190 Ida (d.ca 1227) dau.of Cte Gerard de Vienne

1.1.1.2.Frederick, Duke von Bitsch, d.7 Apr 1206; m.ca 1160 Ludmilla (d.Poland before 1211) dau.of Duke Miecislaw of Poland

1.1.1.2.1.Duke Frederick II of Lorraine, d.8/9 Oct 1213; m.by Jul 1189 Agnes (d.19 Jun 1226) dau.of Ct Theobald of Bar

1.1.1.3.1.1.3.2.2.1.4.Duke Francis Stephen of Lorraine (Lunéville 8 Dec 1708-Innsbruck 18 Aug 1765); because of his marriage to the daughter of the last Habsburg emperor, he became the Austrian candidate for the emperor's throne; he had already renounced the duchies of Lorraine and Bar in 1736 as part of an international treaty aimed at keeping the balance of power; in return, he succeeded in 1737 as Grand Duke of Tuscany; after the Austrian and Hungarian troops fended off the French and Bavarians [the Prussians were satisfied with taking Silesia], Francis was crowned as Emperor Franz I Stefan in 1745; he m.Vienna 12 Feb 1736 Archduchess Maria Theresa of Austria (1717-1780); for their descendants see Section 3

Section 2, Part 1.

Rudolf I von Habsburg (1218-1291; See Section 4) was a little-known count when elected King of the Romans in 1273. After he was elected he persuaded the electors to sanction his grant of Austria and Styria to his sons, and the Habsburgs were based in Austria from then until 1918. He m.1st 1245 Gertrud von Hohenberg (1225-1281); he m.2d 1284 Agnes=Isabelle of Burgundy (1270-1323); he left issue:

1.Albrecht I, Duke of Austria, Styria, Carniola and the Windische Mark 1282, German King 1298 (Jul 1255-murdered at Königsfelden 1308, bur Wettingen); m.Vienna 1274 Elisabeth (d.Vienna 28 Oct 1313) dau.of Meinhard V Gf von Görz-Tyrol

1.1.Rudolf III, Duke of Austria and Styria 1298/1306, King of Bohemia 1306-7 (ca 1282-Horazdiowitz 4 Jul 1307, bur Prague); m.1st 25 May 1300 Blanche of France (d.Vienna 19 Mar 1305, bur Vienna); m.2d shortly after 8 Sep 1306 Pss Elisabeth of Poland (1 Sep 1288-Königgrätz 19 Oct 1335, bur Brünn)

1.1.1.a dau., by 1st m., d.young

1.2.Friedrich I der Schöne, Duke of Austria & Styria 1306, German King 1314 (1289-Gutenstein 13 Jan 1330, bur Mauerbach); m.Ravensburg 11 May 1315 Infanta Isabella of Aragon (1305-12 Jul 1330)

1.2.1.Friedrich (1316-1322, bur Königsfelden)

1.2.2.Elisabeth (1317-23 Oct 1336, bur Mauerbach, moved to Vienna 1783)
